meanings.definition: To convert data from a period of time to an annual basis.
meanings.sent1: I need to annualize the quarterly sales figures to compare them accurately.
meanings.sent2: It is important to annualize the monthly expenses to understand the yearly budget.
meanings.sent3: Trying to annualize the daily weather forecast for the whole year seems like a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She decided to annualize her workout routine, aiming for a year-round fitness plan.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a clever trick to help the students annualize the weekly homework assignments.

meanings.definition: To calculate or adjust for a yearly rate or amount.
meanings.sent1: The financial analyst will annualize the investment returns for better comparison.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to annualize interest rates to understand the total cost.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would annualize his daily coffee intake to see the yearly caffeine consumption.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to annualize the employee bonuses, ensuring fairness across the year.
meanings.sent5: She found a simple way to annualize her savings goals, making it easier to track progress.
